displayName.text: Oriental Culture Enterprises Co. Inc. (Eastern Bookstore)

formattedAddress: 13 - 17 Elizabeth St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10013, USA

Oriental Culture Enterprises Co. Inc. (Eastern Bookstore)
Oriental Culture Enterprises Co. Inc. (Eastern Bookstore)

adrFormatAddress: 13 - 17 Elizabeth St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10013-4803, USA

editorialSummary.text: Spacious shop with books from China, Hong Kong & Taiwan, plus art, musical instruments & more.

originalText.text: 4 stars for fulfilling a community need. This store has A LOT of books in Chinese that would be hard to find in a regular bookstore. I was so happy to see books in Cantonese, about learning Cantonese. While Cantonese is considered a major Chinese dialect, practically all "Learn Chinese" books are really Learn Madarin. So happy to see multiple books in relation to Cantonese. Tbf, heads up, no refunds or exchanges, which is a downer. Atmosphere is rather stifling when there's hardly anyone around. Edit: Forgot to add, prices are on the higher side.

originalText.text: Has been around for a long time. Lots of Books from China, Taiwan & HongKong. Books on all kinds of subjects like health, cooking, classic literature, kid books, etc. Good reference materials. Chinese calligraphy supplies. Books in English & Chinese or both. Ping pong equipment, musical instruments, stationery & cds...

text.text: Has been around for a long time. Lots of Books from China, Taiwan & HongKong. originalText.text: I’m Japanese calligrapher. I ordered Chinese traditional flaming for my works to this store. It took longer than expectation (more than two weeks) but still works were great. Friendly people there. Only Chinese people should call if you have questions. Reception lady does not know English at all. Except that, nice place!!

originalText.text: Eastern Bookstore NYC is a local gem and has been an important cultural institution in the area for nearly half a century. My wife, award-winning author Qin Sun Stubis, held the U.S. launch of her new book, "Once Our Lives," there and we were beyond impressed by the bookstore's brilliant staging of the event and their extreme attention to detail. The store boasts a wealth of Asian literature and calligraphy tools, and the gallery is a beautiful exhibition and presentation space. Our grateful thanks go to manager Amy Wen, Michelle, and Xuanqi Jiang for hosting this magnificent event and helping to make it a huge success! We highly recommend Eastern Bookstore and its caring, capable staff!

We highly recommend Eastern Bookstore and its caring, capable staff!

originalText.text: Gone downhill. This used to be a bustling little store with lots of Chinese books and gifts. Now nobody goes there, and it's because everything is overpriced. I finally found a paper lantern that I was prepared to buy for $9.99, and the cashier promptly decided that the price tag was wrong; it was supposed to be $12.99. I laughed and walked out of the store. I wonder whether anyone else shopped there today. I'm guessing no.
